51. The swiftest of these one saw climbing up
in a maple tree, holding in her hands
a long bough she had gathered up
and defended/defending herself with it; the others,
having no confidence in earthly protection,
instead leapt into a river to flee the shame,
and one saw their white bodies
floating in the transparent flowing water.

52. As their rescue was now apparent,
since they were over the water on the opposite bank,
they sat down, puffing and panting with the effort,
to dry their wet hair. And it appeared that they
all together, with words and gestures,
mockingly accused their pursuers, without stopping,
for they had been unable to get hold of them.

55. On a large rock, somewhat lower,
sat Mercury with his cheeks puffed out
playing on a reed pipe; with a devious air
and flashing eyes, looking at the spot next to him
where a white heifer stood,
and it seemed that he was pondering
with malice how he might best swindle
the many-eyed Argus out of it.
